title.rendered: Man sentenced to 5 years jail by US DOJ for a crypto scam.

content.rendered:
A Florida native has been sentenced to 5 years of jail in a crypto scam case where he duped investors of $100 million through unregistered EmpiresX.

Joshua David Nicholas, a Florida native, pled guilty to scamming investors of $100 million in digital assets through his participation in EmpiresX, a cryptocurrency network. Consequently, he might spend up to five years in Federal prison.

The US government incarcerated a new Florida-based criminal gang last month. Three Miami residents, Esteban Cabrera a Core, Luis Hernandez Gonzalez, and Asdrubal Ramirez Meza, have been sentenced to 30 years in prison for carrying out a $4 million bank and cryptocurrency scam.

AI and Human Intelligence for Profits

The US Department of Justice (DOJ) released a statement claiming Joshua David Nicholas was the “Head Trader” for EmpiresX, a cryptocurrency exchange that “guaranteed” profits to users. The exchange was, after all, a scam that stole digital assets worth $100 million from naive investors. Nicholas and his coworkers lied to customers throughout the company’s runtime, touting the usage of AI and human intelligence to increase their profits.

EmpiresX was similar to the many Ponzi schemes; it never bothered to register with financial authorities or take any precautions to ensure the company could operate legally.

The platform’s head conducted securities fraud in a conspiracy, and since he pled guilty before the court, he faces a maximum of five years in the Federal penitentiary. The court will take into account the US Sentencing Guidelines before making a final judgment.

Users who have been victims of the scam were urged to report it on the US Department of Justice’s website. So, they can learn more about submitting an impact statement and being compensated.
